summary: Three hub UI fixes: (1) VouchersHub empty state now uses the static Gift icon instead of a dynamic lookup. (2) Both VouchersHub and ReservationsHub edit mode cards now use the same inline pattern as ShoppingHub/TasksHub — checkbox left, content center, trash right — replacing floating absolute-positioned circles. (3) Bulk action bar in both hubs now uses the burgundy primary color for the delete button and always shows a Cancel button, matching Shopping/Tasks.
deliverables: src/components/VouchersHub.tsx — Gift icon in empty state; inline edit mode cards; burgundy delete + Cancel in bulk bar
src/components/ReservationsHub.tsx — inline edit mode cards; burgundy delete + Cancel in bulk bar

qa_test_cases.description: VouchersHub empty state shows the Gift icon
steps: Go to Vouchers hub with zero lists created (or delete all existing voucher lists)
qa_test_cases.expected: Empty state shows the Gift (gift box) icon at 64px in burgundy (#630606), text 'No Vouchers Yet', description, and 'Create Your First Voucher List' button. Icon should be the same Gift icon used in the bottom navigation.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub empty state shows Calendar icon and correct text
steps: Go to Reservations hub with zero lists created (or delete all existing reservation lists)
qa_test_cases.expected: Empty state shows the Calendar icon at 64px in burgundy, text 'No Reservations Yet', description 'Start organizing your restaurant bookings, tickets, and events', and 'Create Your First Reservation List' button. NO 'vouchers' text visible anywhere.

qa_test_cases.description: VouchersHub edit mode — inline card layout (no floating circles)
steps: Go to Vouchers hub with at least one list
Tap the Edit (pencil) button in the header
qa_test_cases.expected: Each card shows: square checkbox on the left edge, list content (icon + name + count) in the center, trash icon on the right edge — all inline within the card. No floating circular badges outside the card boundaries.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub edit mode — same inline card layout
steps: Go to Reservations hub with at least one list
Tap the Edit (pencil) button in the header
qa_test_cases.expected: Same inline layout as VouchersHub: checkbox left, content center, trash right. Consistent with ShoppingHub and TasksHub edit patterns.

qa_test_cases.description: VouchersHub — selecting a card in edit mode
steps: Enter edit mode in VouchersHub
Tap the checkbox or content area of a card
qa_test_cases.expected: Checkbox fills with burgundy and shows a ✓. Card border becomes 2px solid burgundy (#630606). Selection counter appears in the bulk bar.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub — selecting a card in edit mode
steps: Enter edit mode in ReservationsHub
Tap the checkbox or content area of a card
qa_test_cases.expected: Same selection behavior: burgundy checkbox, burgundy border, counter in bulk bar.

qa_test_cases.description: VouchersHub bulk bar — delete button is burgundy, not red
steps: Enter edit mode in VouchersHub
Select at least one list
qa_test_cases.expected: The 'Delete Selected' button has a burgundy (#630606) background — NOT red (#DC2626). Matches the delete button color in ShoppingHub and TasksHub.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub bulk bar — delete button is burgundy, not red
steps: Enter edit mode in ReservationsHub
Select at least one list
qa_test_cases.expected: Same as above — 'Delete Selected' button is burgundy.

qa_test_cases.description: VouchersHub bulk bar — Cancel button always visible in edit mode
steps: Enter edit mode in VouchersHub (with or without selecting items)
qa_test_cases.expected: A 'Cancel' button is always visible on the right side of the bulk bar, even when no items are selected. Tapping it exits edit mode and clears selections.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub bulk bar — Cancel button always visible in edit mode
steps: Enter edit mode in ReservationsHub
qa_test_cases.expected: Same — Cancel button always visible. Tapping it exits edit mode.

qa_test_cases.description: Single-item delete via trash icon still works
steps: Enter edit mode in VouchersHub
Tap the trash icon on a specific card (do NOT use the bulk bar)
qa_test_cases.expected: A confirmation modal appears asking to delete that specific list. Confirm → list is deleted. Other lists are unaffected.

qa_test_cases.description: ReservationsHub — single-item delete via trash icon
steps: Enter edit mode in ReservationsHub
Tap the trash icon on a specific card
qa_test_cases.expected: Confirmation modal appears for that specific reservation list. Confirm → list deleted.

qa_test_cases.description: Edit mode header button visual — active state fills burgundy
steps: In either VouchersHub or ReservationsHub with lists present
Observe the edit button before and after tapping
qa_test_cases.expected: Inactive: hollow circle with pencil icon. Active (edit mode): filled burgundy circle with ✓ checkmark. Consistent with ShoppingHub/TasksHub header buttons.

qa_test_cases.description: No regression — normal (non-edit) card tap still navigates into the list
steps: Ensure NOT in edit mode
Tap a list card in VouchersHub or ReservationsHub
qa_test_cases.expected: App navigates into the list, showing the voucher/reservation items. No unintended edit mode behaviour.
